title: Blue gradient background and improved contrast for the sticky main header

requirements.summary: Replace the headerâ€™s semi-transparent background with a full-width blue gradient while keeping sticky, blur, and border behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: The `<header>` in `frontend/src/components/Header.tsx` uses Tailwind gradient classes (e.g., `bg-gradient-to-r` or similar) with blue tones and no longer uses `bg-background/95` or `supports-[backdrop-filter]:bg-background/60` as the primary background.
The gradient is visible in both light and dark mode and remains full-width across the viewport.
Header remains `sticky top-0` with the existing z-index behavior and still renders correctly on desktop and mobile.

file_operations.description: Update the <header> wrapper className to remove the current `bg-background/95` and `supports-[backdrop-filter]:bg-background/60` background styling and replace it with a full-width blue Tailwind gradient (e.g., `bg-gradient-to-r` with blue/sky/indigo stops). Keep existing `sticky top-0`, `z-50`, `w-full`, `border-b`, and `backdrop-blur` behavior intact so the header remains sticky, blurred, and bordered across viewport sizes.

requirements.summary: Ensure header foreground elements (brand, nav buttons, theme toggle, mobile trigger) remain readable with distinct hover/active states on the new gradient without editing immutable UI component sources.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation labels and icons remain clearly legible against the gradient in both themes (no low-contrast text).
Hover and active states remain visually distinct on the gradient background for both desktop nav buttons and the mobile sheet trigger.
No files under `frontend/src/components/ui` and no immutable hook entrypoints are edited.

file_operations.description: Adjust header foreground classes to ensure strong contrast on the blue gradient: set brand/title area text/icon styling for legibility; override Button `className` props (without changing Button source) for desktop nav, theme toggle, and mobile sheet trigger to use high-contrast text/icon colors and distinct hover/active backgrounds suitable for a gradient (e.g., white/near-white text with subtle translucent hover/active fills). Ensure both desktop and mobile navigation states (active vs. inactive) remain visually distinct while keeping existing nav items/routes/icons unchanged.
